    Introducing pataqu

Bin

Source: R/bin.R
bin.Rd

Bin and summarise without fitting

Usage

bin(df, y = y, x = x_new, by = NULL, fun = stats::median, k = k)

Arguments

df

tibble() typically returned by quake()

y, x

colnames to use. Default to y/x_new

by

colname for grouping structure (besides k). Default to NULL

fun

to use to summarise y

k

colname for iteration . Default to k.

Examples

animals_q %>% bin(y=value, by=taxa, fun=mean)
#> # A tibble: 400 × 4
#>        k taxa  x_bin            y_bin
#>    <int> <fct> <fct>            <dbl>
#>  1     1 cat   [-75,-19.6]   -0.0384 
#>  2     1 cat   (-19.6,-2.48] -0.0754 
#>  3     1 cat   (-2.48,16.9]  -0.0823 
#>  4     1 cat   (16.9,59.8]    0.0182 
#>  5     1 cat   (59.8,79.3]    0.0495 
#>  6     1 bird  [-75,-19.6]   -0.0244 
#>  7     1 bird  (-19.6,-2.48] -0.0174 
#>  8     1 bird  (-2.48,16.9]   0.00499
#>  9     1 bird  (16.9,59.8]    0.0233 
#> 10     1 bird  (59.8,79.3]   -0.0102 
#> # … with 390 more rows

animals_q %>% bin(y=value, fun=mean)
#> # A tibble: 100 × 3
#>        k x_bin           y_bin
#>    <int> <fct>           <dbl>
#>  1     1 [-75,-19.6]   -0.0130
#>  2     1 (-19.6,-2.48] -0.0172
#>  3     1 (-2.48,16.9]  -0.0267
#>  4     1 (16.9,59.8]    0.0110
#>  5     1 (59.8,79.3]    0.0170
#>  6     2 [-75,-19.6]   -0.0175
#>  7     2 (-19.6,-2.48] -0.0126
#>  8     2 (-2.48,16.9]  -0.0323
#>  9     2 (16.9,59.8]    0.0202
#> 10     2 (59.8,79.3]    0.0137
#> # … with 90 more rows
